TITLE: Biden wants more Ukraine aid. Congress won’t make it easy.
SUMMARY: Chuck Schumer wants to combine the president's plea for more Ukraine cash with Covid aid that Republicans stonewalled earlier this month.

TITLE: Audio: McCarthy told colleagues he would seek Trump’s resignation after Jan. 6
SUMMARY: The tape could complicate the California Republican's quest to become Speaker of the House.

TITLE: Capitol Police backtracks on airplane threat after ordering evacuation
SUMMARY: An Army plane was circling the area around the Capitol, part of a parachute stunt at Wednesday night’s Nationals baseball game.

TITLE: Jan. 6 panel piecing together details of final Trump-Pence call
SUMMARY: Several Donald Trump allies listened in from the Oval Office, but Mike Pence's side of the call remains elusive.

TITLE: ‘The world is on fire’: How vulnerable House Dems are bracing for GOP attacks on crime
SUMMARY: Democrats see Rep. Abigail Spanberger's district as competitive but winnable in a tough midterm fight. She thinks addressing GOP attacks on crime head on is key to keeping it.

TITLE: Capitol Police's new vetting practices raise 'First Amendment concerns,' whistleblowers' lawyer says
SUMMARY: An attorney for Capitol Police employees wrote that intelligence analysts were “directed” to search the social media pages of congressional staff, event attendees and hosts.

TITLE: More Dem Senate hopefuls split with Biden on border
SUMMARY: Five more Senate candidates have joined growing Democratic calls for the administration to come up with a more detailed plan before revoking pandemic-era border restrictions.

TITLE: McConnell-tied super PAC makes early $141M play for the Senate
SUMMARY: The Senate Leadership Fund's record-breaking spring advertising reservations follow a $106 million commitment from its Democratic counterpart as the midterm battle heats up.

TITLE: Fred Upton: Slim House majority could spell trouble for post-midterms GOP
SUMMARY: The retiring Michigan Republican spoke of his party's ability to get legislation passed.

TITLE: Seeking: GOP dealmakers who won't 'burn the House down'. Apply to: Kevin McCarthy.
SUMMARY: The undisputed frontrunner for speaker next year is set to lose a half-dozen Republicans from his conference who prefer negotiating to obstinacy. That could be a problem.

TITLE: Criminal justice reform faces political buzzsaw as GOP hones its midterm message
SUMMARY: Bipartisan leaders on the Senate Judiciary Committee want to strike a follow-up deal to their 2018 work. But that's complicated by Republicans' focusing on rising crime.

TITLE: 5 crucial decisions as Jan. 6 investigation reaches final stage
SUMMARY: Do they push Donald Trump or Mike Pence to testify? Will GOP lawmakers answer questions? The insurrection committee is in the endgame now.

TITLE: Cheney says Jan. 6 committee has enough evidence for a criminal referral for Trump
SUMMARY: Her statement followed a New York Times report that said the panel is divided on whether to move forward.

TITLE: The Supreme Court question Republicans won't answer
SUMMARY: They could have a Senate majority in 2023. But they won't say, definitively, how they would treat another Joe Biden Supreme Court nominee.

TITLE: Democrats exasperated with Biden on gun control
SUMMARY: "It's time for more urgency from the administration," says Sen. Chris Murphy, an ally of the president.

TITLE: ‘Don’t need to be absolutists’: Black Dem caucus searches for practical wins
SUMMARY: After facing setbacks on voting rights and police reform, senior Black Democrats are looking for scaled-back wins, such as fixing sentencing disparities.

TITLE: From judge to justice in 6 weeks: How Schumer got Jackson confirmed
SUMMARY: Jackson’s confirmation came at a good time for Biden and the Senate majority leader, as Democrats face major political headwinds across the board.

TITLE: Senate punts $10 billion in Covid aid until after Easter amid stalemate over border policy
SUMMARY: Democrats had grudgingly settled for a far smaller Covid aid package than they wanted and that federal officials and public health advocates say is needed.

TITLE: In the fight against Putin, Senate unanimously approves measure that once helped beat Hitler
SUMMARY: The Senate revived Lend-Lease, a World War II-era measure that allowed the U.S. to quickly resupply Allies in the fight against Nazi Germany.

TITLE: GOP laying early plans for its own Hunter Biden probes
SUMMARY: DOJ is already investigating how the president's son handled his overseas business dealings. Republicans — particularly in the House, where they're eyeing a majority — want their own oversight, never mind the Trump parallels.

TITLE: Dem moderates get choosy in midterm recruits as GOP headwinds grow
SUMMARY: After getting walloped in 2020 and now facing a flurry of departures, the party's House centrists are hunkering down to focus on ground game.

TITLE: Mark Kelly's breaks with Biden pile up
SUMMARY: The other Arizona Democrat has started drawing ire from progressives as he distances himself from his own party on border and economic policies.

TITLE: Covid deal hampered by GOP opposition to Biden immigration policy
SUMMARY: Republican senators want a vote on a pandemic-era immigration limit before they'll consider moving forward on $10 billion in Covid aid.

TITLE: GOP Rep. Fred Upton to retire
SUMMARY: Rep. Fred Upton, one of the longest-tenured Republicans in the House of Representatives, has decided to retire rather than seek reelection in 2022.

TITLE: Senate strikes $10B Covid deal
SUMMARY: The agreement leaves out global pandemic aid, a possible hurdle for Democratic support in the House.

TITLE: Dems plot spring sprint for party-line spending deal with Manchin
SUMMARY: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer says the resuscitation of the bill once called Build Back Better is a “high priority” for his caucus. But a revival won't be easy.

TITLE: Jamie Raskin: Gap in Jan. 6 White House logs of 'intense interest' to select committee
SUMMARY: The Maryland Democrat said the House committee wants to be able to tell the full story of that day.

TITLE: Blunt says Jackson will make history, but he won't vote for her
SUMMARY: “I think she’s certainly going to be confirmed," the Missouri senator said.

TITLE: Sarah Palin announces run for Congress
SUMMARY: The announcement came about 45 minutes before the filing deadline to enter into the special election.

TITLE: Cawthorn blames ‘the left and the media’ after intra-GOP furor over sex-and-drugs comments
SUMMARY: Cawthorn has faced widespread public criticism from congressional Republicans and within the North Carolina GOP following his comments on a podcast.
